column4: ubuntu for x86_64 works pretty well too.  it's the 32 bit stuff that's kind of a pain
blame apt.  it can't handle multiple architectures at once
i'd rather use windows than use gnome's file selector, that's for sure
Why?
it drives me nuts.  the autocomplete behavior is by far the worst
Why is it the worst
it autocompletes while i'm still typing.  so if i type "/usr", it ends up as "/usrsr"
What version of GTK+ are you using?
beats me.  the one that installed with firefox, the only app where i'm unfortunate enough to suffer that behavior
Try "dpkg -s libgtk2.0-0", and tell me what the version is
tells me that it's not installed.
What version of ubuntu?
can't even find it with dpkg -l.  i doubt firefox is statically linked
hoary
Strange
actually, it seems to have stopped doing that.  i know it used to
well, problem 1 of 2334525346 with that file selector solved
Ok, what are the other problems?
just lack of features, like detail and thumbnail view.  both of which i've had many occasions to use

i've used the detail view to sort by owner in a directory where people drop all kinds of stuff.  i probably don't use it that often.  thumbnail view i do all the time, since i'm always slinging pictures around
with detail view in windows i can pick arbitrary metadata.  too bad it's just about impossible to make explorer remember which columns I want in explorer view
common lisp interface manager
